result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas Lavern Mcgrail

OFF RECORD/ 8:52 AM Defendant Thomas Lavern Mcgrail in court.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court addresses the DEF and request he contact the CoC weekly for a status update on a court appointed attorney. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:17 AM Defendant Thomas Lavern Mcgrail in court.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Court gives the DEF the attorney colloquy.    DEF wishes to wait for attorney to be appointed.  Court reset initial appearance.  Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Initial appearance scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Initial appearance on November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No Contact with 12146 N Mosquito Brook Road, Hayward
No Contact with 12146 N Mosquito Brook Road, Hayward

McGrail, Thomas L   CASE:  22092301

Burglary to Building or Dwelling
Criminal Trespassing
Received notification from Public Defenders Office, DEF does not qualify for PD appointment, and was given instructions to contact Clerk of Court Office to apply for court appointed attorney.

11:30 AM DE Thomas Mcgrail in court, appearing in custody by video from the Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Gabriel Pollak (special appearance) appears by video.  Jennifer Gross appeared in person for the State of WI.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  DE does not qualify for public defender.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Pollak  no objection.  Court sets bond.   Court gives the DE the attorney colloquy. Court sets INITIAL APPEARANCE for 10/11/2022 at 8:30AM.  

SIBS $10,000 NO CONTACT WITH  12146 N Mosquito Brook Road, Hayward
Hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:29 am.
